Reviews.Title: “This hotel is dated, smelly and and in need of an overhaul.”
Reviews.Author: Ladyat
Reviews.Content: If you want cheap then this is it but if you want cleanliness then look somewhere else. Terrible odors and outdated decor. A little scary for me. Dont know how I made it through the night.

Reviews.Title: “Business traveler”
Reviews.Author: laura w
Reviews.Content: Days Inn Baltimore is conveniently located in the city, with access to the many reasons for visiting there. I went last week and am a frequent business traveler. The hotel is kept very nice, clean and good size rooms. The reception people that I encountered, at least 3, were accommodating, cheerful and helpful. I especially enjoyed Pat and her good humor and professionalism. I highly recommend this if you are visiting the University and/or Inner Harbor area, or stadiums.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: JoCoop52
Reviews.Content: Nice large clean room with friendly staff. GREAT LOCATION

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Susan_MacRoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, every thing was great. No problems at alI. Can not figure out what the negative comments were all about ? Must be in bad mood and take it out on the hotel

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ateam11235
Reviews.Content: we stayed at days inn 5701 Baltimore National Pike. great stay. but they should tell you that it is in Catonsville, not Baltimore. problem with gps system. but they are very accommodating!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, not my fave, but OK.”
Reviews.Author: bluegatorade97
Reviews.Content: I stayed here earlier in the year for a night to attend the state geography bee. The lobby was clean, and all the furniture was from the Ross Dress for Less across the street, & there was a drunk lady in it arguing with the Indian front desk clerk about directions to somewhere. My room was nice, but (is this shocking?) there was hair caught up in the towel. The bathroom was clean and bright and the shower products were great as well. There were NO bugs, drugs, or trash in the room. After I had dinner at a separate restaurant I came back and around 11PM, a lady was walking up and down, up and down, up and down the hallway SCREECHING on her phone. I called the front desk and the clerk came up to my floor and told the lady to leave and she did. This is why the sleep quality is marked as "poor". The next morning, I went down to the Daybreak breakfast at 7AM and it wasn't fully up-and-running yet, but I got some food and sat down. A few minutes later, I got up to use the waffle iron and the Indian lady running the breakfast comes up and shouts, "NO HOT! NO HOT!". I realized it hadn't warmed up and waited a few minutes and she told me it was ready. The waffles were good, long story short. The food selection was lackluster, to be honest. Juice and coffee, cold donuts and cereals, milk, etc. All in all, the hotel was good and I was pleased with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: AGeorge751
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpfull upon check-in and throughout our stay. The room was a pleasant spacious and comfortable. Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!!”
Reviews.Author: angelbear425
Reviews.Content: Disgusting and dirty hotel; filthy room- hair, stains, makeup, lipstick, and skin particles on sheets and pillow cases, broken headboard, hole in wall, sheets were yellowed and grey with age, They gave us new sheets, but the pillows had yellow stains all over them. Carpeting was pulling away from the wall. Bullet-proof glass at the desk in the lobby, shady characters also hanging out in the lobby. Smelled disgusting- like moth balls and food. I was in the hotel less than 30 minutes, but because I checked in early in the day they refused me a refund even though I didn't stay in the property. Instead I opted to drive the 3.5 hours home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: chrispalank
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for profesional conference in the Baltimore Conference Center which is just across the street. The hotel is small, but the service is big!!! housekeeping was very ameniable to my schedule, the restaurant and bar offered great pub food and the font desk was very helpful. Justin, front desk, was very efficient and customer oriented. Parking was easy and only $20/day. The hotel i only 1 block for inner harbor and less than one block from Camden Yards. I think this is a Hidden Gem!

Reviews.Title: “Drive on to the next hotel”
Reviews.Author: skygirl340
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before flying out of Baltimore - it was late at night and we needed somewhere to go and we were passing here. I would not stay here again. The hotel is out of date and has a really funny smell. Our room was on the top floor and when we eventually struggled up with all our bags we thought our key didn't work. But then we could see the card was being recognised and got the green but the door still wouldn't open. In the end we literally had to push our bodies into the door to make it open. I felt a little uneasy in case of an emergency that the door wouldn't open but we were so tired we didn't bother doing anything about it. On first look the room looked ok and the bathroom looked like it was recently re-done. On closer look the bed sheets were dirty and had hairs that were not ours all over the sheets. The same thing with the towels. Disgusting. Breakfast was as expected, nothing special but enough to get you started for the day. There seems to be loads of guest rooms at this hotel but the car park was empty at night so it seems it has hardly any guests - so no wonder they are charging too much...they have to get the money from somewhere. They have the usual tourist leaflets in lobby but the ones I saw were all out of date from years gone by. I wouldn't stay here again - there are plenty of other hotels around that I'm sure would be better - with no funny smell!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money, Not as Bad as other Ratings-Recent renovations helped a lot”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTraveler87
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical staying here after reading the reviews but the rates were low and and I needed a place to stay close to the city. I was suprised when I first visited because the hotel isn't as bad as the reviews make it out to be--I went back to check and realized that most of them had been written 1-2 years ago. I was told that the hotel recently underwent renovation and revamped all the rooms. My room was clean and comfortable. I didn't find a smoky smell or dirty sheets. A pretty standard room with the usual amenities. Nothing too fancy, but that's what I expected from a Days Inn. Having stayed at Days Inn's before, I can definitely say that this hotel is probably one of the nicer ones. The staff was friendly and helped me navigate around downtown Baltimore. Overall, I was satisfied with my stay and the service I received. Definitely a great value considering the low price and quality accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff, nice rooms, hot waffles, good value, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: NEPAjtraveler
Reviews.Content: Thought maybe we were in the wrong hotel when we got there; it was much nicer than we were expecting based on older reviews. Nice, clean rooms with mini-fridge, microwave, coffee, and hairdryer. Comfortable beds. No bugs. Staff were friendly and went out of their way to be accommodating. The continental breakfast wasn't super exciting, but it has the usual items, and the kids liked the make-your-own waffles. Great value - about half the price of a hotel in the inner harbor and the drive in (695 south to 95 N right past Camden yards and into downtown) was relatively fast, even in the morning rush hour. (don't take 40 - it's scary). Plenty of fast food close to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever !”
Reviews.Author: xoxopinkprepxoxo
Reviews.Content: I was with my Youth Group here around sometime years ago. The floor looked and felt more comffy than the beds the pool was dirty and very tiny. All through out the night people were jumping on the bed in he room above me and the front desk didnt do anything about it when we called complained 3 times. The breakfast was disgusting we went to another place becauseno ate more than one bite of there food!

Reviews.Title: “Scary!”
Reviews.Author: Poopingpolly
Reviews.Content: I am a young female, and I stayed at the hotel alone a few years ago. It seemed ok from the outside, and inside the lobby there was glass around the front desk. I chalked that up to being a city thing I wasn't used to, and checked in. The room was unremarkable, but there was a smoke smell despite being in a non-smoking room. What I remember the most was that I did not sleep a wink, because there were people shouting in the halls and banging around outside my door. I do not know why the people were in the hotel, but it was scary and I was sure I would be murdered before the night was over. It was a miserable night. I have never felt so unsafe in a hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - especially for the money.”
Reviews.Author: SarahSharp
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice - once with our kids (16 months and 2 1/2 at the time) and, for the money, its a great place to stay. No, its not a 5 star Ritz, but its also not your typical junky "Days Inn" if you know what I mean. It has a nice pool outside, a restaurant inside and is in a great location for going ot the the inner harbour, the baseball stadium and anywhere else in the area. The only complaint I had the two times I stayed there was the elevator - so slow!! But its an elevator - if your going to let that ruin your vacation, your just looking for bad stuff! So if your looking for a low priced good quality place to stay while in Baltimore, I'd say stay here - no fancy frills, but a nice clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharon17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just stayed here for 4 nights and just wanted to let everyone know that the hotel was excellent for the money. Clean room with everything we could want - fridge, microwave, safe. They were more than happy to look after our bags on the check out day until we were happy to collect them. In particular the staff were all really friendly and helpful. The only down side was the stag and hen party that stayed on the Saturday night and were a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & in poor condition.”
Reviews.Author: MightyClong
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel blind from Hotwire. The area wasn't exactly the best, but the hotel looked decent from the road & it was close to several restaurants (most being fast food). This is where the positives end. The lobby had a run-down & trashy feel to it, & the desk staff was marginal. There was a box @ the front desk where they were giving away cell phone chargers that guests had left behind. I thought that was a great idea...even if I were unfortunate enough to leave mine behind (b/c they can't do anything w/them & by the time you pay to have it shipped, you can just get a new one). The hallways had a odor to them & so did my room. The room itself was also in marginal condition & the internet access wasn't working. I was leary of sleeping in the bed. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, for any reason. *DISCLAIMER* I stayed @ this Days Inn in August 2007, but haven't written a review until now b/c I didn't feel like taking the time. However, I've since found reviews very valuable in my travels & wanted to return the favor to fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: jenibean1430
Reviews.Content: After driving for 9 hours we were definitley ready to check into our room. The first thing I noticed was a hair in the bathroom towel (not the hair from your head..YUCK!) My husband and I were getting ready for bed, I pulled down the comforter and found a big bloody stain. I realize they change the sheets (I hope) and not the comforters, but come on now. I am in no way a hotel expert, we don't stay in them very often so I guess I kind of figured it would be cleaner than it was. Suffice to say, I wont be going there again. I did leave the comforter stain side up when we left in the hopes someone would notice it.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting and dreadful”
Reviews.Author: christian1515
Reviews.Content: I don't think they have housecleaning. They never showed up. We brought out the couch bed and there was a big red stain in the middle of it. Then we have a 14 month old daughter who walks around and puts things in her mouth. Well there were pills on the floor under the desk. Another thing is the people are rude and the food is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: laxgroup
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a group. The halls smelled of urine. The bedspreads were stained. One room had bed bugs...we did get that room for no charge. This was the worst hotel experience ever. Two families refused to stay there and left for more appealing accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not Safe !!”
Reviews.Author: reindhar7
Reviews.Content: We have two laptops stolen and everything in the room and my luggage has been ransacked. We didn't realize the room door was not working well. You can enter without any keys. Beware !!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: LdyJedi
Reviews.Content: Oh, my. I'm a little worried, reading that the hotel has already undergone reservations. We are only here because all of the Inner Harbor hotels were sold out for a convention this weekend (that we're also attending). I saw two young children(!!) carrying cleaning supplies into the rooms to, I would assume, clean the bathroom. This might explain why a room booked for two people originally only had 1 washcloth, 1 hand towel and 1 bath towel in it. I called to ask for another set and received an additional washcloth and hand towel, but no bath towel. The hotel itself was decorated in early American garage sale. Nothing matches. The towels are worn to nubs. There are no fewer than five patterns in the bathroom itself and even more in the main room. The airconditioning had two options: frigid and off. I like it cold, but even I couldn't handle having cold air blowing on me constantly. The shower never got hot. The TV? All purple - what channels that actually worked were tinted purple, anyhow. There was no way to adjust the color. The promised WiFi was apparently there, but did not hold a connection at all on either of our laptops. We'd connect and be booted about 5 minutes later. This became quite the frustration late in the evening. I will not be staying here again. I'd rather drive the 90 minutes from home each day instead!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place to stay, an horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so bad I cannot even emphasize enough. We made a resevation for a non-smoking room, but when we got there they said they only have smoking rooms left and they are not going to do anything about it. We had to take it because we already paid with our credit cards through hotel.com and it was too late to cancel according to the policy. I stayed there for 2 days, and it was the worst living conditions of my life. The people on the front desk are so rude! I think the hotel are run by india people. They had india accent, but I dont know which part of the middle-east they are from. The room smelled so bad that we had to open the window and took a large fan from the hallway and blowed it at high speed in our room 24/7. This made it so noisy, we couldnt watch tv and made it so hard to sleep at night, but that was better than the smells and odor. When we got to the room, its had opened shampoo bottles, dirty towels inside the bathroom, when we called for clean towels, we had to go down from the 6th floors to get the supplies, and people in the front desk did not seem too happy about giving us extra towels. They said they have high speed internet, we could not log onto the server. When we went downstair to ask them for help, they said we have to bring our laptop and stay in the lobby if we want to go online, because that's the only location where the internet works. The water from the sink doesnt come out at certain time. As for the tub, while I was taking a shower the water alternates between cold to burning hot every several seconds. We had to call a technician up and he said we have to apply certain tricks to it to keep the water stable, and you can see the pipe sorting of falling out the walls. The bathroom is the grossest thing ever. The sink and the toilet are only 2 feet above the ground., as if the bathroom was made for dwarfs or little kid size. We had to bend down so low to use them. The elevator smells like a bathroom, period. (and you have to use it alot if you stayed on the upper floors) The good things about this Day Inn, they have a lot of parking spaces, a fridge, and microwave, and some movies channels. Stay here if you want to ruin your vacation or whatever reason you were here.

Reviews.Title: “wont stay here anymore”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i had handicapped family and they put us in the very end of the hallway. we stayed on 2nd floor the ice machine didnt work. the hallways were extremely dark and the hotel smelled like dog urine and wet dog. our room was pretty dark even with curtains open. the carpets and bedspreads had cigarette burns all over. the refrigerator made a terrible sound at night. i found small roaches in the bathroom. and asked for deoderizer to be sprayed in the room while we were gone. that didnt happen. i needed to use the business center and had to argue to get the key for it on 2 occasions. the dayshift had given me a receipt with password for it and the night shift says we know nothing about it. they finally gave in & gave me the key. housekeeping couldnt speak english so i had to ask the front desk for our room to smell better. the cont breakfast were dried out donuts. needless to say we went to the double t for all but one breakfast. no mgmt ever helped me out with our problems or would give in on some reimbursement. i did write a letter after we returned and got a letter back thanking me for my comments and now they knew some things needed improved on. i wont stay there again. planning another trip in oct and will be staying at the comfort inn next door

Reviews.Title: “Not the place to go”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night. We were told prior to arrival that the hotel had cribs ("$10" they said). We were told upon check-in that there were cribs available, but it was not delivered to our room. By evening we called the desk and were told that they do have cribs ("$5 is the price" according to this desk clerk), but none were available...and no cots or rollaways either. Upon our request we were told that we could come and pick up extra sheets & blankets. (Our baby slept with us that night.) The room (though it had a no smoking sign in it) had a very smoky smell in it. The ice machine did not work. Some fitness equipment did not work. A continental breakfast was provided.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unclean”
Reviews.Author: AlitomNewYork
Reviews.Content: Hotel did not have its pool in working order and boasted of a state-of-the art fitness facility, however, most of the equipment was not in working order. Our room was not cleaned by the housekeeping staff on the 2nd day of our stay, even though we were out of our room for 12 hours during the day. The managers were unwilling to help us with this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK PARKING VERY BAD”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was ok. This was my second time staying here only because it is by the convention center. This year my room smelled like smoke and after spraying air spray it smelled like it the whole weekend. Then the didn't bring us back any wash rags.. The elevators was bad.... BUT! the worst the front desk lies about the parking I paid 33.00 when I was told it will be 22.00 when I spoke to the hotel manager he was like no one had told you that. As if I needed to lie. I go every year the Days Inn is not where I will be staying no longet!

Reviews.Title: “convention bound”
Reviews.Author: goldensecret
Reviews.Content: We arrived on tuesday oct 21 2003 We found our room to be in good shape. The room was clean and re stocked ie towels each day. There was no smell. We stayed until sat 25. The parking was ample as we drive a 1 tonne truck and had no troubles manouvering it. The drive to the inner harbour was 14 min. We had a great time in baltimore

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn Baltimore
HotelInfo.Address: 5701 Baltimore National Pike West Rte 40, Baltimore, MD 21228
